fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Business and Industry, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives:
Community Guidelines on State Aid to Maritime Transport. We support the idea of really implementing the objectives of the guidelines, in particular the need to sail under an EU flag. So far only 50% of the EU owned fleet sails under a member state flag. 
 
Also: 
 
- Process of REFIT of Maritime Safety legislation - https://ec.europa.eu/transport/modes/maritime/consultations/2016-refit_en_en  
 
- Maritime transport strategy - https://ec.europa.eu/transport/themes/strategies/2018_maritime_transport_strategy_en
organisation_name: European International Shipowners Association of Portugal (EISAP)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
EISAP’s objective is to represent the interests of Portuguese and international shipowners  with ships registered in MAR.   
  
Its aim is to contribute to the promotion, development and harmonization of MAR in close collaboration with the International Business Centre of Madeira, with the Madeira Regional Government and with other relevant stakeholders. 
  
It further aims to contribute to strengthening Portugal’s maritime sector by supporting the creation of jobs for young Portuguese and European students in the maritime industry, onboard ship 
and ashore.   
  
EISAP is also seeking to foster the creation of a significant maritime cluster in Portugal, to work with professionals and experts from all sectors of the shipping industry, and to encourage the establishment of business relations and coordination of research both nationally 
and internationally on legal and other issues, allowing members to have access to relevant information on the maritime industry.   
  
As an instrument of representation and research and knowledge, EISAP also aims to coordinate 
its activity with international associations with similar objectives and to assure representation 
in national and international organizations.
relevant_communication: We are not particularly interested in changing the current EU legislation but enforcing the existing rules, regulations and guidelines. We recommend the EU to take its own policy with regard to encouraging European shipowners in using member state flags more seriously.
